WorkItem.Description:
Let's say we have a workbook in an .xls(x) file we read with a reader. 
There are two sheets in it: 'First Sheet' and 'Second Sheet'. The second sheet has a reference to the first like "='First Sheet'!A1". 
If we delete first sheet in PHPExcel and then try to save, we will get Fatal error:  Call to a member function cellExists() on a non-object in /.../PHPExcel/Calculation.php on line 3094, because $pCellParent->getParent()->getSheetByName($matches[2]) will return non-object. 
Â 
I think this shouldn't cause Fatal error, but rather just an empty cell or something like this.
WorkItem.Summary: Reference to deleted list causes Fatal error

Comments.Message: P. S. I think this shouldn't cause Fatal error, but rather just an empty cell or something like this.
